title: 113_s1268
content: The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is defined in this section. It also defines the Compact of Free Association. Public Law 99-658 is amended to include the results of the Compact Review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau in 2010 are approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal year 2011, funds may be withheld. The Republic of Palau may have funds withheld if they withdraw more than $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds for certain provisions under the Compact of Free Association within 30 days of enactment. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific sections of the Agreement. Additionally, authorizations of appropriations are provided for subsidizing postal services to certain countries for fiscal years 2014 through 2024. The Federated States of Micronesia will receive $1,500,000 annually from 2014 to 2024. Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association will also receive necessary funds. Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed. Payment schedules and fund withholding are outlined in the Agreement. The Federated States of Micronesia will receive $1,500,000 annually from 2014 to 2024 under the Compact Section 211(f) Fund. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a schedule from 2014 to 2023. Additionally, a grant of $6,912,000 for 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 will be provided for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Government of the United States will provide a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 to establish the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Government of the Republic of Palau will match these contributions with $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of Appendix A to the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide funding for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund, with the Government of the Republic of Palau matching the contributions. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide $10,000,000 to Palau in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, $69,250,000 in economic assistance will be provided to Palau, with $12,000,000 allocated for fiscal year 2014. The Government of the United States will provide $69,250,000 in economic assistance to Palau in yearly installments from 2014 to 2023, with varying amounts allocated each fiscal year. The funds for economic assistance will be provided in 4 quarterly payments, with varying percentages allocated each quarter unless specified otherwise. Infrastructure projects will be governed by a specific section in the Agreement. The United States will provide $40,000,000 in grants to Palau for infrastructure projects over several fiscal years. Additionally, there is an amendment to extend a program until 2024 and a clarification on passport requirements. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories may be admitted without certain passport requirements if they are citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands or acquire citizenship of Palau. Citizens of Palau, whether by birth, naturalization, or acquiring citizenship after the effective date of the Constitution, are permitted to work in the United States with the Secretary of Homeland Security's approval. However, their right to establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory or possession may be subject to non-discriminatory limitations outlined in U.S. statutes or regulations. Citizens of Palau can work in the United States with approval from the Secretary of Homeland Security. However, their right to establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory may be subject to non-discriminatory limitations outlined in U.S. statutes or regulations.
